items.title: Human Resources and Recruiting Coordinator
items.content:
Human Resources and Recruiting Coordinator at ConsenSys

Brooklyn, Remote · Full Time
Compensation
$50K–$55K
0.01%–0.01%
Visa Sponsorship
Available

Job Description

Apply Here:

ConsenSys is a venture production studio focused on building and scaling tools and enterprise software products powered by Ethereum. Our mission is to use these solutions to power the emerging economic, social, and political operating systems of the planet.

Our teams are busy at work building the future of identity, financial markets, commerce, the music industry, security and infrastructure, and more. To accomplish this, we’ve built out a flat organizational structure which we call the ConsenSys Mesh; a network of individuals & teams working autonomously and towards the same goal. The MeshOps team is responsible for designing and implementing “Meshocracy”, our own operational & company structure loosely based on the principles of holacracy. If you are someone that thrives in a fast-paced environment where being self-directed, determined, and resilient are a requirement, we would love for you to join us.

The Role

The Human Resources and Recruiting Coordinator is an integral member of our team! We need help telling our story around the world! In this role you will develop a solid foundation of knowledge and experience as part of a greater global team serving countless internal customers and projects on 6 continents. You will have the opportunity to build candidate relationships, and partner with recruiters, human resources and hiring managers. The ideal candidate seeks career growth within Recruiting and/or Human Resources and will provide support in many different areas. This is truly a choose your own destiny situation, and a chance for ownership. This role will grow and evolve as ConsenSys grows and incolves

Build excellent relationships across our organization
Create welcome packages and kits for new hires
Coordinate interview activities on-campus and in-house including, but not limited to, scheduling and calendar invites; interview confirmation emails; reserving interview rooms and telephone/video conference (when necessary); and candidate debrief calls/meetings
Schedule and coordinate logistics for all campus recruiting events, e.g. RSVPs, payment/check requests, calendar invites, etc.
Manage inventory for all recruiting swag and ensure all swag is readily available.
Coordinate offer letter process and as well as onboarding set-up
Provide support on special projects and initiatives
Assist with the internship program and internal events
Assist with wellness endeavors
Required Skills:

Meticulous attention to detail and strong organizational skills with proven ability to prioritize and complete projects within deadlines
Self-starter who loves taking initiative
Creative problem solver
Discreet and able to manage sensitive information
Flexibility, high energy and a positive attitude
Prior experience in a Recruiting or Human Resources department is preferred
Familiarity with applicant tracking systems, HR systems and social media is preferred
Ability to focus on the details, but also understand the bigger picture
Bonus Points:

Interest in new technology, Blockchain, and/or Ethereum
Humble, kind, and doesn't take themselves too seriously

items.title: Worldwide, REMOTE, full time or part time -- 100% flexibility. $70-100/hr. Expert Interviewer at Karat (https://karat.io) Work ...
items.content:
Worldwide, REMOTE, full time or part time -- 100% flexibility. $70-100/hr. Expert Interviewer at Karat (https://karat.io)

Work from anywhere in the world that has a solid internet connection. Work as much or as little as you want. Work any day, any time of day, any number of hours -- you can do 0 one week, 50 the next week, and back to 0 the next week. Only requirement there is that we want you to roughly average at least 10 hours a week, or else the training/time investment doesn't make as much sense from your end or ours. When each interview is done, you're done.

I know the above might sound a little strange, so a bit about the company for context: Karat is a Seattle-based startup that does software engineering interviews on behalf of other companies -- primarily first-round phone screens. Quickly-growing companies can spend a significant fraction of their engineers' time interviewing; we help take the load off. We've done a lot to make the interview experience better for all stakeholders that I could write whole essays about, but suffice it to say that candidates love working with us, clients love working with us, and we're well-funded and growing quickly as a result.

Because of this quickly-growing demand, we're looking to hire more Expert Interviewers. The ideal candidate is a software engineer with strong written and verbal English skills with at least a few years of professional experience. Interviewing experience would be great, but we spend 25 hours (paid) training you before you even start, so if you're strong technically and love working with people we can usually make it work :) Interviews are conducted over video chat, using a collaborative code editor.

Some of our interviewers are freelancers who use our scheduling model to backfill hours; others are full timers at top tech companies looking to make some extra cash; others have quit their jobs to work with us full time; some are digital nomads; one of our interviewers is road tripping around North America for a year and a half, doing anywhere from zero to 40 interviews each week depending on where he is and what the weather's like.

The application form is here: https://jobs.lever.co/karat/d44ab283-c7c0-4bbd-b8c3-4dc0ced6...

I know it's a pretty unique job, so if you have any questions reply here or email me at josh@karat.io and I'm happy to talk through any of it.

P.S. We're also hiring for our internal team -- particularly looking for senior engineers, dev managers, and a product manager right now; for those we generally prefer local (Seattle) candidates, though we do cover relocation. More details on those here: https://karat.io/careers, or feel free to email me if you have any questions.

items.title: Senior Childcare Recruiter
items.content:
The company
myTamarin Childcare Matchmaker is hiring! Join us to build the world's best childcare service. Be a part of small team and shape the company as well as the childcare industry as a whole.

myTamarin has been recognised as one of the most innovative business by the Innovate UK in 2018, and backed with one of their grants.

myTamarin is grounded in psychology, powered by technology and fueled by our team’s dedication & hard work. Our mission is to empower parents to fully enjoy early parenthood.

The role
This isn't a standard childcare placement role. It is much more!

You will be working alongside the founder, and the development team. You will set up and independently run our matchmaking for maternity and nanny jobs, and will over time build and manage a team of childcare matchmakers.

You will participate in honing our ground-breaking matchmaking approach, building our brand and awareness, and growing our community of parents and child carers.

You will be looking for new business opportunities and to improve our existing ways of working. We believe that there is always room for improvement.

Your experience
Previous childcare recruitment experience would be an advantage, but other recruitment, sales or customer service backgrounds will also be considered. Having experience as a parent using childcare, or a child carer will be seen as a plus, but is not mandatory.

You are
Passionate. Passionate about building better services, and are motivated by change and improvement.
Organised doer. You have lots of drive and are self-motivated. You are well organised with good administrative skills.
People's person. You have excellent communication and customer service skills. Phone conversations don't wear you out.
Competitive. Yes, so are we. Our founder was a competitive alpine skier and can't resist a good challenge.
Team player. Tamarins, who inspired our brand, are monkeys who parent in family groups. They spread the workload while the children are young so that everyone can enjoy early parenthood fully.
Confident with modern technology. E.g. MS Office etc. This is a non-brainer, right?

Salary
£25,000 - £30,000 a year + commission + company stock options negotiable for the right person

Start date
Asap, with immediate interviews initially via video calls, then in person in London

Location
Central London; flexible work arrangements possible (e.g. some work from home)

Qkids
Headquarters: Xiamen, China
https://qkidshiring.com/job/wwr/

Online English Teacher, Part time Tutor, Remote
Employment type: Contract, part-time
Duration: Flexible
Start date: ASAP
Location: Remote, online
Hours: 6-19 hours/week
Rate: $16-20 USD/hr

 


ABOUT US: Qkids is a national leader in cross-cultural E-learning, teaching English to over 100,000 Chinese elementary and secondary school students through a patented and effective gaming platform that connects students and teachers in real time. Guiding students through a curriculum of fun, dynamic, and engaging narrative gaming adventures, English teachers from the United States and Canada lead students to English mastery from the comfort of their own homes. Qkids provides incredible workplace flexibility that caters to any schedule. We are ready to build lasting growth for both students and teachers. With your help, we can continue to impact cross-cultural communication positively. Join today, and let's shape the future of E-Learning together!

RESPONSIBILITIES:
-Teach English to Chinese children between 5 - 12 years of age through Qkids’ interactive software program. Knowledge of Chinese is not necessary. Each class is 30 minutes. All curricula are preset and incorporated with animated characters and games. There is paid training before orientation. Further training and support is provided along with your coursework.  
-Available to teach a minimum of 6 hours (12 classes) per week. There are 19 hours (38 classes) available weekly.

Plus Friday and Saturday - Night Eastern Time (PM - EST): 7:40-8:10, 8:20-8:50, 9:00-9:30, 9:40-10:10   10:20-10:50

REQUIREMENTS:
-Native fluency English speakers who are based in United States, Canada. This is due to the limitation of our internet server and we do not discriminate against nationality.
-Earned a degree or currently enrolled in a university program.
-Prior teaching experience or experience with early childhood education.


HIRING MATERIALS:

If you are invited to our hiring process, we will ask for 3 pieces of hiring materials including your available time slots, computer spec, and an introduction video including your level of education, any experience working with children or as a teacher, and 1 minute of a teacher read-aloud.

items.title: Technical Recruiter
items.content:
Status

Status is building powerful decentralized apps on Ethereum that change the way we do things on the web. Our rapidly growing team is made up of self-motivated individuals who prosper in a fast-paced environment and value the ability to work from anywhere. As a product, Status is an open source discovery tool for the Ethereum blockchain that makes it easy for anyone to access apps and services built on the decentralized web. Status also allows users to browse, chat, make payments and more.

Opportunity

Although still in its infancy, blockchain technology is developing rapidly and is poised to have a profound impact on our social, financial and legal systems. By joining us, you’ll help to craft the way people interact with these technologies.

Job role

We are looking for a Technical Recruiter that will find new international talents to join our amazing team. Your main duties include managing the full-cycle recruiting process´s while ensuring both hiring managers and candidates have great experiences.

Responsibilities

  • Develop and manage full-cycle recruiting process, from a detailed job briefing to contract signature
  • Build up steady pipeline of suitable candidates using all possible channels (including direct search)
  • Create an exceptional applicant experience and make sure everyone receives on-time feedback
  • Support employer branding concepts and projects
  • Manage hiring manager´s expectations and advise on future needs and team culture.

Requirements

  • 5+ years of experience in recruiting, preferably in high-growth startups
  • Solid experience recruiting varied profiles including Tech profiles
  • Excellent Business English skills
  • Experience working in a remote team is highly valued
  • International work experience in recruiting
  • Outstanding interpersonal skills
  • Proven track record in recruiting

Working at Status

We're a remote team of made up of 55 people scattered around the globe. Everyone at Status works from a location of their choosing - and we all meet up twice a year to strategize and strengthen our relationships.

We care deeply about open source software, and our organizational structure does away with a strict hierarchy and fixed work hours. We believe in working with a high degree of autonomy while supporting the team's priorities.

Permanent
Mid Level Developer (JavaScript)

Cardiff Bay

My client are innovative, pioneering and multi-award winning. They are a well-established Financial Services company based in Cardiff Bay who value themselves on using all the latest and leading technologies to stay on top of a continuously evolving industry and as a result, we are looking for dynamic, like-minded individuals to join them on their journey.

The real challenge will be to keep up with the demand from new clients and using the latest technologies, to develop components, services and web applications that will help shape their operations.

You will be working within a cross-skilled, agile team, developing maintainable, efficient web applications whilst implementing them on to new products. We are ideally looking for someone with a passion for the Software Development process and someone who is experienced within one or more of the following languages/frameworks: , JavaScript, AnguarJS, ReactJs, PHP, Python, HTML and CSS.

This is a fantastic opportunity to get on board with a very established company in the Cardiff market with a great brand and reputation. The ideal candidate will have strong JavaScript fundamentals with a solid knowledge and understanding of modern frameworks such as Angular, React or similar technologies.

ESSENTIAL SKILLS :
  • Passionate about Software Development
  • Excellent knowledge and expereinces with one or more of the following languages, frameworks and libraries: Web API, JavaScript, AnguarJS, ReactJS, PHP, Python, HTML and CSS
  • A working knowledge of common software development and architectural patterns
  • Understands all aspects of the software development life cycle
  • A self-starter and motivated learner
  • Key team player
  • Excellent communication skills
We have great salaries and the opportunity to progress, also, with a brilliant benefits package on offer including: Flexible working hours, part remote working, company holidays, competitive salary, group life assurance, private health care.

If the idea of joining an incredibly diverse team of developers sounds appealing, where you can have the opportunity to absorb new approaches and practices, then please submit your CV today!

items.title: Talent Acquisition Analyst
items.content:
Talent Acquisition Analyst - Jobmote

Talent Acquisition Analyst

Clevertech

DESCRIPTION

Clevertech is looking for a gifted talent acquisition analyst to work with us in our people operations department. to join our worldwide team. Help create the culture for the developers who are creating world class software products for the most exclusive companies in the world.

From ensuring standards, to providing access to training and development, to organizing online talks attended by hundreds of participants you help set the mood for our developer teams.

You get excited about getting the best out of team members and have demonstrated the finesse required for people operations.

You enjoy doing puzzles, talking to new people and insightfully understanding their strengths and weaknesses.You can tell the difference between a type A and type B personality and flesh out strengths in your candidates. Familiarity with technology and software development is a plus, as well as HR best practices and community management.

No cold calling. No passive recruitment. This position is about doing an initial screen of existing candidates and growing our community of developers and designers.

BENEFITS

Own Your Time

We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust and a lot of flexibility. World travellers, young parents, nature lovers, and commute avoiders love working here. We are a collective of like minded people in over ten countries, and our global perspective shapes our every move.

Focused Work

You will work together on a dedicated team with your eye on one finish line at a time. Our teams are nimble and agile, and cover the technical range you would expect in world class product delivery teams. And keep your eye on the mail - we send out swag everywhere in the world and there are celebratory pictures of Clevertech socks, hoodies, and mugs all over slack.

Learn at your edges

We believe in learning and provide unique programs that improve your tech skills, leadership skills and even challenge you in personal development. CleverFridays, guest speakers, mentorship opportunities and in-depth industry exposure are all on offer here.

And of course, if you speak at a tech conference, we cover all expenses.

Recharge Time

We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out why.clevertech.biz.

We believe in learning and provide unique programs that improve your tech skills, leadership skills and even challenge you in personal development. CleverFridays, guest speakers, mentorship opportunities and in-depth industry exposure are all on offer here.

And of course, if you speak at a tech conference, we cover all expenses.

Recharge Time

We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out why.clevertech.biz.

items.content:
Online English Teacher, Part-time, $16-20 USD/hr

Posted Jan 17

Qkids
Headquarters: Xiamen, China
http://teacher.qkids.cn/wwr


Employment type: Contract, part-time
Duration: Flexible
Start date: ASAP
Location: Remote, online
Hours: 6-19 hours/week
Rate: $16-20 USD/hr

ABOUT US: Qkids is a national leader in cross-cultural E-learning, teaching English to over 100,000 Chinese elementary and secondary school students through a patented and effective gaming platform that connects students and teachers in real time. Guiding students through a curriculum of fun, dynamic, and engaging narrative gaming adventures, English teachers from the United States and Canada lead students to English mastery from the comfort of their own homes.

Qkids provides incredible workplace flexibility that caters to any schedule. We are ready to build lasting growth for both students and teachers. With your help, we can continue to impact cross-cultural communication positively. Join today, and let's shape the future of E-Learning together!


 


RESPONSIBILITIES:


-Teach English to Chinese children between 5 - 12 years of age through Qkids’ interactive software program. Knowledge of Chinese is not necessary. Each class is 30 minutes. All curricula are preset and incorporated with animated characters and games. There is paid training before orientation. Further training and support is provided along with your coursework.  


-Available to teach a minimum of 6 hours (12 classes) per week. There are 19 hours (38 classes) available weekly.


[Our class time slots]
7 days a week - Morning Eastern Time (AM - EST): 5:40-6:10, 6:20-6:50, 7:00-7:30, 7:40-8:10
Plus Friday and Saturday - Night Eastern Time (PM - EST): 7:40-8:10, 8:20-8:50, 9:00-9:30, 9:40-10:10   10:20-10:50


REQUIREMENTS:


-Native fluency English speakers who are based in United States, Canada. This is due to the limitation of our internet server and we do not discriminate against nationality.


-Earned a degree or currently enrolled in a university program.


-Prior teaching experience or experience with early childhood education.


HIRING MATERIALS:

If you are invited to our hiring process, we will ask for 3 pieces of hiring materials including your available time slots, computer spec, and an introduction video including your level of education, any experience working with children or as a teacher, and 1 minute of a teacher read-aloud.

items.content:
Facebook User Acquisition at ConsumerAcquisition.com

San Francisco, Austin, Los Angeles, Remote · Full Time
Skills
Facebook Advertising

$80K–$135K
No Equity
Visa Sponsorship

Job Description

Are you passionate about Facebook advertising and user acquisition? Do you want to deliver world-class performance to clients while having autonomy and personal freedom? If so, then we want to work with you!

We are looking for entrepreneurial individuals who are seeking an analytically challenging and strategic role with a fast-growing startup.

Manage all aspects of Facebook and Instagram advertising campaigns using our proprietary software, AdRules.
• Oversee execution and optimization of Facebook advertising campaigns to exceed clients’ goals across many verticals.
• Plan, manage, optimize, and report on paid social media campaigns.
• Become an expert in Facebook advertising and the AdRules platform.
• Write ad copy and work with graphic designers to optimize images.

Responsibilities:
• Manage all aspects of Facebook and Instagram advertising: build ads, analyze data, optimize continuously and manage creative testing.
• Develop strategies to exceed clients’ performance goals.
• Create images in Photoshop (or manage external designers) and write ad copy to optimize performance.
• Analyze your ad spend and use the data to formulate your strategy.
• Optimize ads for efficiency based on performance data using our AdRules platform.
• Develop client-facing skills on weekly calls, deliver strategic insights and daily summaries.

Requirements:
• Strong analytics, quantitative and problem-solving skills; ability to analyze raw data, draw conclusions, and develop actionable recommendations.
• BA / BS / MBA or 2+ years’ experience in high-scale, hands-on performance marketing role with Facebook Ads and User Acquisition.
• Experience in performance marketing, online advertising, media buying, lead generation or consulting.
• Strong understanding of ads metrics (CPI, CTR, CPC, CPM, CPA, ROAS, ROI, LTV).
• Advanced knowledge of Excel.

Benefits:
• Highly competitive salary.
• Work from home flexibility.
• Uncapped vacation and sick time.
